title: Rotational kinematics - ratio of ang accelerations

content.question: Wheel <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> begins at rest and rotates through one complete revolution with constant angular acceleration <math alttext="alpha sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>α</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> in a time <math alttext="delta t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>t</mi></math>. Wheel <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> also begins at rest and rotates through one complete revolution, but with constant angular acceleration <math alttext="alpha sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>α</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> in a time <math alttext="2 delta t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mtext>Δ</mtext><mi>t</mi></math>. Which of the following correctly indicates the ratio <math alttext="alpha sub 1 to alpha sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>α</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>:</mo><msub><mi>α</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>?

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
